tools.title: Mood Tracker
tools.description: Monitor your emotional patterns over time to gain valuable insights into your mental well-being and identify triggers.
tools.disclaimer: This tool is for self-reflection purposes only and is not a diagnostic instrument. Results should not be used as a substitute for professional mental health care.

questions.question: How would you describe your overall mood today?
How well did you sleep last night?
How anxious or worried have you felt today?
How connected do you feel to others today?
How much energy do you have right now?

low.title: Time for Extra Self-Care
low.message: Your responses suggest you might be going through a challenging time. Remember, it's okay to not be okay. Consider reaching out to supportive people in your life or exploring our resources for additional support.
recommendations: Consider speaking with a mental health professional
Try our Evening Wind Down audio reflection
Read: The Art of Letting Go

moderate.title: Finding Balance
moderate.message: You're experiencing a mix of highs and lows, which is a normal part of life. Consider incorporating some of our mindfulness practices to help maintain equilibrium.
recommendations: Read: 5 Morning Rituals for a Centered Day

high.title: Thriving
high.message: You're doing well! Keep nurturing the habits and connections that support your well-being. Consider sharing your positive energy with others.

tools.title: Stress Inventory
tools.description: Evaluate your current stress levels and discover personalized strategies for managing and reducing daily pressures.
tools.disclaimer: This assessment provides general guidance and is not a clinical evaluation. If you're experiencing significant stress, please consult a healthcare professional.

questions.question: How often do you feel overwhelmed by your responsibilities?
How well are you able to relax when you have free time?
How often do physical symptoms of stress affect you (headaches, muscle tension, etc.)?
How confident do you feel in handling unexpected problems?
How often do you make time for activities you enjoy?

low.title: High Stress Levels
low.message: Your responses indicate you may be experiencing significant stress. It's important to prioritize stress management and consider seeking support.
recommendations: Read: Mindful Breathing Techniques for Anxiety

moderate.title: Moderate Stress
moderate.message: You're managing but could benefit from additional stress-reduction strategies. Small changes can make a big difference.

high.title: Well-Managed Stress
high.message: You're handling stress effectively. Continue your healthy practices and stay mindful of maintaining balance.

tools.title: Balance Check
tools.description: Assess the harmony between different areas of your life and find opportunities for creating better equilibrium.
tools.disclaimer: This tool helps identify areas for growth and is not a clinical assessment. For personalized guidance, consider consulting a life coach or therapist.

questions.question: How satisfied are you with your work-life balance?
How much time do you dedicate to your physical health?
How fulfilled do you feel in your relationships?
How often do you engage in personal growth activities?
How aligned do your daily activities feel with your values?

low.title: Seeking Balance
low.message: Your life may feel out of balance in several areas. Start by identifying one area to focus on and make small, sustainable changes.

moderate.title: Growing Balance
moderate.message: You're making progress toward balance. Continue nurturing the areas that are working and gently address those that need attention.

high.title: Living in Balance
high.message: You've created meaningful harmony across life areas. Your practices are serving you wellâ€”continue to nurture and refine them.
